simulated_ratings.title: Draughtsman's Contract, The (1982)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A stylized period mystery with a sly edge sounds intriguing even if its mannered humor may keep me a bit detached.

simulated_ratings.title: Haunting, The (1963)
simulated_ratings.feeling: I’m drawn to restrained, suggestive hauntings that build dread through atmosphere.

simulated_ratings.title: Wages of Fear, The (Salaire de la peur, Le) (1953)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Slow-burn, high-stakes suspense on a perilous journey is exactly the kind of tension I enjoy.

simulated_ratings.title: Ride with the Devil (1999)
simulated_ratings.feeling: The Civil War setting interests me, though the romance and western mix might soften the intensity I prefer.

simulated_ratings.title: Dead of Night (1945)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Classic anthology chills and an ominous framing nightmare hit my atmospheric-horror sweet spot.

simulated_ratings.title: Passion of Joan of Arc, The (Passion de Jeanne d'Arc, La) (1928)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Intense, austere historical drama is exactly the kind of classic that grips me.

simulated_ratings.title: Night of the Living Dead (1968)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Claustrophobic survival and mounting dread are right in my wheelhouse.

simulated_ratings.title: Alien (1979)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Meticulous sci‑fi atmosphere fused with body‑horror terror is everything I love.

simulated_ratings.title: I Walked with a Zombie (1943)
simulated_ratings.feeling: The moody island setting and quiet unease sound compelling.

simulated_ratings.title: Innocents, The (1961)

simulated_ratings.title: Female Trouble (1975)

simulated_ratings.feeling: Offbeat, nerdy competition comedy sounds mildly engaging.

simulated_ratings.title: Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring, The (2001)

simulated_ratings.feeling: Impeccable stop‑motion craft and clockwork heist suspense outweigh my usual coolness to broad comedy.

simulated_ratings.title: Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King, The (2003)

simulated_ratings.title: The Golden Voyage of Sinbad (1973)

simulated_ratings.title: Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers, The (2002)
simulated_ratings.feeling: The split journeys and mounting dread work for me, even if the battle spectacle crowds out some of the atmosphere I prefer.

simulated_ratings.title: Babe: Pig in the City (1998)

simulated_ratings.title: Exorcist, The (1973)

simulated_ratings.title: Joe's Apartment (1996)

simulated_ratings.title: Wrong Guy, The (1997)
